sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Religious Freedom and Marriage Fairness Act.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Religious Freedom and Marriage Fairness Act.

sections.heading: Purposes; rules of construction
sections.text:
This Act shall be liberally construed and applied to promote its underlying purpose, which is to provide same-sex and different-sex couples and their children equal access to the
status, benefits, protections, rights, and responsibilities of civil marriage.
Nothing in this Act is intended to abrogate, limit, or expand the ability of a religious denomination to exercise First Amendment rights protected by the United States Constitution or the Illinois Constitution nor is it intended to abrogate, limit, or expand the Illinois Human Rights Act or the Religious Freedom Restoration Act.

sections.heading: Private clubs. Nothing in this Act is intended to abrogate, limit, or expand the exemption for private clubs under Section 5-103 of the Illinois Human Rights Act
sections.text: Private clubs. Nothing in this Act is intended to abrogate, limit, or expand the exemption for private clubs under Section 5-103 of the Illinois Human Rights Act.

sections.heading: Religious freedom.
sections.text: Nothing in this Act shall interfere with or regulate the religious practice of any religious denomination or Indian Nation or Tribe or Native Group. Any religious denomination or Indian Nation or Tribe or Native Group is free to choose which marriages it will solemnize or celebrate.

sections.heading: Severability. If any part of this Act or
sections.text:
its application to any person or circumstance is adjudged
invalid, such adjudication or application shall not affect the
validity of this Act as a whole or of any other part.

sections.heading: The Illinois Marriage and Dissolution of Marriage Act is amended  by repealing Section 213.1.
sections.text: The Illinois Marriage and Dissolution of Marriage Act is amended by repealing Section 213.1.

sections.heading: Severability. The provisions of this Act are severable under Section 1.31 of the Statute on Statutes.
